address: Thị trấn Kông Chro, Huyện Kông Chro, Tỉnh Gia Lai
thought:
**My Analysis of Address Mapping for Gia Lai Province**

Okay, so I've got an address to map to new administrative units.  It's from "Thị trấn Kông Chro" in "Huyện Kông Chro", "Tỉnh Gia Lai".  Let's see what we can do.

First, I'll confirm that Gia Lai isn't being merged out of existence, as it is listed in the resolutions: The province itself will not be merged, so that's good.

Now, the main focus is on the old ward. I'm looking for mentions of "Thị trấn Kông Chro" in the "Other resolutions," specifically focusing on those dealing with administrative changes. And bingo! Line 68 of Resolution 1664/NQ-UBTVQH15 catches my eye. It clearly states that "Thị trấn Kông Chro", along with other areas, is being merged into the new "Xã Kông Chro". Perfect! The resolution's title even matches the province.

Next, I need to verify that "Xã Kông Chro" exists in the list of new wards for Gia Lai. Sure enough, there's a direct match: `{"ward_code":"23824","ward_name":"Xã Kông Chro","province_name":"Tỉnh Gia Lai"}`.

With this solid mapping, I can build my JSON output. The resolution line provides the necessary citation details, and the match is direct, so the confidence level should be high.  The province name will obviously be "Tỉnh Gia Lai". The ward code is "23824", and the ward name is, as confirmed, "Xã Kông Chro". Although there is only one result, because the schema requires an array of objects, that is how the JSON output will be created.

This mapping is straightforward, and the output is well-defined.

citation.header: 1664/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Gia Lai
citation.line: 68. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của thị trấn Kông Chro, xã Yang Trung và xã Yang Nam thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Kông Chro.
